medical_history.chief_complaint: Right lower quadrant pain for 3 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain started 3 days ago with initial diarrhea and mild subfebrile condition. Diarrhea improved, but pain progressively worsened. Pain is greatest in the right lower quadrant with some mild epigastric discomfort and right flank pain. Patient also experienced poor intake, nausea, and vomiting (no blood). Stools near baseline with chronic loose stools (2 BM/day). Mild increased urinary frequency and new onset dysuria noted in the past couple of days. Denied chest pain, shortness of breath, and cough. Notable 15-pound weight loss over the past 7 months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diabetes mellitus type II, hypercholesterolemia, hypertension, severe obstructive sleep apnea, coronary artery disease status post percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty, peripheral vascular disease, remote history of total abdominal hysterectomy, and appendectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Positive for two brothers with myocardial infarctions. Family history of cancer and diabetes.
